page.title: 15 RELIGION
page.content: There are five churches in the villages of Beguildy and Felindre, three of which are in the survey area.They are St.Michael's Church, Beguildy and the Baptist and Methodist Churhes in Felindre. St.Michael's belongs to the Church-in-Wales and was built in the fourteenth century. Much of it has been rebuilt. The Vicar of Beguildy, Rev. Martin Davies is also vicar of St. Peter's Church, at Crugybyddar three miles up the valley. There are 87 people on the electoral roll of these churches. Of those about 40 attend church regularly. The Baptist Church was built in 1854 and now has 9 members. Services are held once a month at 3 p.m. The Methodist Church was built in 1876 and has 8 members at present. Services are held every Sunday at 3 p.m.
